intro: Erigeron alamosanus, commonly known as the Alamosa fleabane, is a flowering plant native to the southwestern United States and northern Mexico. It is a member of the Asteraceae family, characterized by its composite flower heads that consist of both ray and disk flowers. The plant typically grows in dry, open habitats such as grasslands and rocky soils. It produces small, white to pale blue flowers that bloom in late summer to early fall. Erigeron alamosanus is often found in disturbed areas and is adapted to arid environments with limited water availability.
